name: Star
description: A brilliant star shines in the spring sky at twilight. The Star card represents inherent ability and training working in concert—nature allied with nurture.

person.upright: A person focused on improving a particular area of skill or behavior.
person.reverse: A person with natural ability but little patience for training or study.

creatureTrap.upright: A creature that has trained to improve itself (perhaps having several skill or saving throw proficiencies), or a trap that requires teamwork to avoid or escape.
creatureTrap.reverse: A creature that relies on its natural abilities instead of training (perhaps with no skill or saving throw proficiencies).

place.upright: A place dedicated to study or training, such as a university or gymnasium.
place.reverse: A place of untouched natural beauty.

treasure.upright: An art object that reflects the skill of its creator, or a magic item that grants proficiency.
treasure.reverse: Unrefined ore or uncut gems, or a magic item that improves an ability score.

situation.upright: A situation that requires or rewards training and practice.
situation.reverse: A situation resulting from someone's refusal to practice or train.
